description: Audit findings quality rules — confidence, effort, evidence, suggestion quality

rules.description: Every finding must include a confidence level (high, medium, or low) indicating verification certainty.
Every finding must include an effort estimate (small, medium, or large) with clear sizing rationale.
Every finding's evidence must be backed by at least 1 actual Grep or Read tool call result — not just file names, sizes, or assumptions.
Every suggestion must be actionable with concrete details: target file names, specific refactoring technique, what to extract/remove/merge.
Final output must include a Stats line with confidence distribution (counts of high, medium, low confidence findings).
